articles.title: Something from “space” may have just struck a United Airlines flight over Utah
articles.description: "NTSB gathering radar, weather, flight recorder data."
articles.content: The National Transportation Safety Board confirmed Sunday that it is investigating an airliner that was struck by an object in its windscreen, mid-flight, over Utah. “NTSB gathering radar, weather, flight recorder data,” the federal agency said on the social media site X . “Windscreen being sent to NTSB laboratories for examination.” The strike occurred Thursday, during a United Airlines flight from Denver to Los Angeles. Images shared on social media showed that one of the two large windows at
articles.author: Eric Berger

articles.description: There's yet another streaming bundle in town, and it will be ideal for fans of Ted Lasso and The Office . Apple and NBC have teamed up to provide both of their streaming services together in a bundle starting at $15 per month. The new Apple TV + Peacock bundle is officially available now for $15 mon
articles.content: There's yet another streaming bundle in town, and it will be ideal for fans of Ted Lasso and The Office . Apple and NBC have teamed up to provide both of their streaming services together in a bundle starting at $15 per month. The new Apple TV + Peacock bundle is officially available now for $15 monthly for the ad-supported tier. This is a mighty fine deal, given that Apple TV recently changed both its name and price . The platform costs $13 per month now on its own. Peacock starts at $11 per mo
articles.author: Lawrence Bonk

articles.title: Ford’s Mustang Mach-E GT California Special blends the old with the new
articles.description: Ford’s Mustang Mach-E is having a relatively good year, outpacing its gas brethren in sales for the month of August. The expiration of the $7,500 federal EV tax credit doesn’t mean much to the Mach-E, which is made in Mexico and therefore ineligible for the credit. But with clouds looming on the hor
articles.content: Ford’s Mustang Mach-E is having a relatively good year, outpacing its gas brethren in sales for the month of August. The expiration of the $7,500 federal EV tax credit doesn’t mean much to the Mach-E, which is made in Mexico and therefore ineligible for the credit. But with clouds looming on the horizon, Ford wants to keep the momentum going by releasing a new special edition version that harkens back to the pony car’s bygone days. The Ford Mustang Mach-E GT California Special, announced today,
articles.author: Andrew J. Hawkins

Beats earbuds and speakers are the more flexible alternatives to things like AirPods and HomePods, and the new Beats Powerbeats Fit keep that
articles.content: Beats devices have been the more colorful, full-of-personality complements to Apple’s clean-and-minimal gear ever since Apple bought the company back in 2014. Beats earbuds and speakers are the more flexible alternatives to things like AirPods and HomePods, and the new Beats Powerbeats Fit keep that tradition alive. Some six months after the Powerbeats Pro 2 debuted earlier this year, Beats now has an updated version of the Fit Pro to offer folks looking for many of the conveniences of an Apple

It’s a
articles.content: Today’s Decoder episode is a special one: I’m talking to Zocdoc CEO Oliver Kharraz, and we chatted live onstage at the TechFutures conference here in New York City. You’re almost certainly familiar with Zocdoc — it’s a platform that helps people find and book appointments with doctors. It’s a classic of the early app economy, right alongside Uber, Airbnb, DoorDash, and others — it’s a friendly mobile app that efficiently matches supply and demand in a way that ultimately reshapes the market. The
articles.author: Nilay Patel

articles.content: The redesigned Oura app includes new features to help users track and manage their stress levels. Oura is launching a redesigned app with expanded stress-tracking insights as it develops new blood pressure features that could identify signs of hypertension. The updated Oura app will introduce a new Cumulative Stress feature that provides a weekly overview of how the body manages and recovers from sustained stress, drawing from sleep, heart rate, temperature, and activity data. articles.title: These nonprofits lobbied to regulate OpenAI — then the subpoenas came
articles.description: On August 19th at 7:07PM, Tyler Johnston received a message from his roommate. A man, the text said, was knocking on their door with legal documents to serve. Johnston is the founder and sole employee of The Midas Project: a nonprofit that monitors the practices of "leading AI companies to ensure tr
articles.content: On August 19th at 7:07PM, Tyler Johnston received a message from his roommate. A man, the text said, was knocking on their door with legal documents to serve. Johnston is the founder and sole employee of The Midas Project: a nonprofit that monitors the practices of "leading AI companies to ensure transparency, privacy, and ethical standards are maintained." The Midas Project is behind The OpenAI Files , a 50-page report about OpenAI's evolution from under-the-radar nonprofit to moneymaking house
articles.author: Hayden Field

If you use the code MONARCHVIP at checkout, you can get an annual plan for 50 percent off. It typically costs $100, but you can get 12 months of access fo
articles.content: Monarch Money is one of our favorite budgeting apps and, fittingly enough, there's a way for newcomers to save money on a subscription right now. If you use the code MONARCHVIP at checkout, you can get an annual plan for 50 percent off. It typically costs $100, but you can get 12 months of access for $50 with this code. There are some key caveats here. The discount is only for new users, and it can't be combined with other offers. The code only works when you sign up through the web. You can't r
articles.author: Kris Holt

articles.title: NPR Music: Kokoroko: Tiny Desk Concert
articles.description: Kokoroko’s NPR Tiny Desk debut finds bandleader Onome Edgeworth ditching pre-show jitters as the seven-piece unleashes a warm, genre-blending groove. The British collective scored “good vibes” from the crowd, effortlessly fusing funk, jazz, afrobeats and R&B into a captivating live set. Their timing
articles.content: Kokoroko’s NPR Tiny Desk debut finds bandleader Onome Edgeworth ditching pre-show jitters as the seven-piece unleashes a warm, genre-blending groove. The British collective scored “good vibes” from the crowd, effortlessly fusing funk, jazz, afrobeats and R&B into a captivating live set. Their timing couldn’t be better: songs from Tuff Times Never Last—an album built around choosing joy in tough moments—shine here. Highlights include the soaring vocals on “Together We Are” and the punchy call-and
articles.author: Music YouTube

articles.title: This retina implant lets people with vision loss do a crossword puzzle
articles.description: Science Corporation—a competitor to Neuralink founded by the former president of Elon Musk’s brain-interface venture—has leapfrogged its rival after acquiring a vision implant that’s in advanced testing, for a fire-sale price. The implant produces a form of “artificial vision” that lets
articles.content: Science Corporation—a competitor to Neuralink founded by the former president of Elon Musk’s brain-interface venture—has leapfrogged its rival after acquiring a vision implant that’s in advanced testing, for a fire-sale price. The implant produces a form of “artificial vision” that lets some patients read text and do crosswords, according to a report published in The New England Journal of Medicine today . The implant is a microelectronic chip placed under the retina. Using signals f
articles.author: Antonio Regalado

articles.title: AI could predict who will have a heart attack
articles.description: For all the modern marvels of cardiology, we struggle to predict who will have a heart attack. Many people never get screened at all. Now, startups like Bunkerhill Health, Nanox.AI, and HeartLung Technologies are applying AI algorithms to screen millions of CT scans for early signs of heart disease.
articles.content: For all the modern marvels of cardiology, we struggle to predict who will have a heart attack. Many people never get screened at all. Now, startups like Bunkerhill Health , Nanox.AI , and HeartLung Technologies are applying AI algorithms to screen millions of CT scans for early signs of heart disease. This technology could be a breakthrough for public health, applying an old tool to uncover patients whose high risk for a heart attack is hiding in plain sight. But it remains unproven at scale whi
articles.author: Vishal Khetpal

articles.title: Should an AI copy of you help decide if you live or die?
articles.description: Doctors share top concerns of AI surrogates aiding life-or-death decisions.
articles.content: For more than a decade, researchers have wondered whether artificial intelligence could help predict what incapacitated patients might want when doctors must make life-or-death decisions on their behalf. It remains one of the most high-stakes questions in health care AI today. But as AI improves, some experts increasingly see it as inevitable that digital “clones” of patients could one day aid family members, doctors, and ethics boards in making end-of-life decisions that are aligned with a pati
articles.author: Ashley Belanger

articles.title: 8-Bit Music Theory: How to Write Gorgeous Chords like Masashi Hamauzu
articles.description: Masashi Hamauzu’s lush, colorful chords often hinge on “Sus Chord Slash Chords,” where suspended tones float over unexpected bass notes, giving his Final Fantasy scores that dreamy, sophisticated vibe. From there, he layers in rich extensions—Minor 11ths for depth, Maj13s for warmth, and Maj7♯11 for
articles.content: Masashi Hamauzu’s lush, colorful chords often hinge on “Sus Chord Slash Chords,” where suspended tones float over unexpected bass notes, giving his Final Fantasy scores that dreamy, sophisticated vibe. From there, he layers in rich extensions—Minor 11ths for depth, Maj13s for warmth, and Maj7♯11 for that signature shimmer—plus sneaky first-inversion Maj2 shapes to keep things fresh. This video walks you through each step: discover the sus slash chord, taste the Minor 11 sound at 2:40, feel the M
articles.author: Music YouTube
